title: Erh-Chi Hsu
text:
I am a PhD student at Johns Hopkins School of Nursing pursuing dual research interests: memory care in long-term care settings and technology use among community-dwelling older adults.
My current research focuses on analyzing the National Health and Aging Trends Study (NHATS) longitudinal data to examine how various technology activities impact cognitive domains. I also conduct policy analysis of Memory Care in Assisted Living using the method of health services regulatory analysis, and performing spatial analysis of long-term care market dynamics using ArcGIS as well.
Due to my personal interest in data visualization, I worked on some side projects, such as an Emergency Room Dashboard, and voluntarily built a program performance dashboard for a non-profit organization that cultivates BIPOC’s young leadership in Baltimore.
By training, I am either a public health or nurse scientist; professionally, I’ve worked as a registered nurse in a geriatric ward and as a mixed-method specialist for a Washington State Department of Health project.
On this site I keep a list of my projects, publications, and presentations, as well as a learning blog.
